intro: Microloma × archeri, commonly known as the hybrid microloma, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically features lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of tubular, brightly colored flowers, often in shades of red, orange, or yellow. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Due to its hybrid origin, it exhibits a range of morphological variations depending on the parent species.
